page.title: 05Armed forces in Canterbury
page.content: The Duke of Edinburgh's{Royal} {Regiment}came to Howe{Barracks,} Canterbury in January 1983 and will be leaving for Northern Ireland at the end of 1985. The Regiment was formed in June 1959 as an amalgamation of the Royal Berkshire and Wiltshire Regiments.{Prince Philip}is the colonel-in-chief and has regularly visited the{Battalion}since its foundation. He came to Canterbury in 1984 and children from Kingsmead school attended and spoke to him. Since its formation the Battalion has served in England, Scotland, Germany, Belize, Canada, Malta, North Africa and Cyprus.
